criteria: Identifying the Environmental Change and its Impact
Proposing a Solution to the Problem
descriptions: Does not identify an environmental change or its impact on plants and animals.
Identifies an environmental change but does not explain its impact, or vice versa.
Identifies an environmental change and provides a vague or incomplete description of its impact on plants and animals.
Identifies an environmental change and provides a clear description of its impact on plants and animals, but lacks detail.
Identifies an environmental change and provides a detailed and accurate description of its impact on plants and animals.
Identifies an environmental change and provides a comprehensive and insightful description of its impact on plants and animals, including potential long-term effects.
Does not propose a solution to the problem caused by the environmental change.
Proposes a solution that is not relevant to the environmental change or is not feasible.
Proposes a solution that is somewhat relevant but lacks detail or a clear explanation of how it addresses the problem.
Proposes a solution that is relevant and provides a basic explanation of how it addresses the problem.
Proposes a well-reasoned solution and provides a clear and detailed explanation of how it addresses the problem.

Proposes an innovative and well-reasoned solution and provides a comprehensive and insightful explanation of how it effectively addresses the problem, considering potential challenges and unintended consequences.
Does not provide any evidence to support the claim about the merit of the solution.
Provides irrelevant or weak evidence that does not support the claim.
Provides some evidence, but it is not clearly linked to the claim or the criteria and constraints of the problem.
Provides relevant evidence to support the claim, but the explanation of how it meets the criteria and constraints is limited.
Provides strong and relevant evidence to support the claim and clearly explains how it meets the criteria and constraints of the problem.

Provides compelling and comprehensive evidence to support the claim and demonstrates a deep understanding of how the solution effectively meets the criteria and constraints of the problem, considering alternative perspectives.
Fails to consider the system components or their interactions related to the environmental change and proposed solution.
Shows a limited understanding of system components and interactions.
Identifies some system components and interactions but does not explain their relationship to the problem or solution.
Describes the main system components and their interactions related to the environmental change and proposed solution.
Provides a detailed analysis of the system components and their interactions and how they are affected by the environmental change and influenced by the proposed solution.

Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of the complex interactions within the system and provides insightful analysis of how the proposed solution impacts the system as a whole, including potential feedback loops and unintended consequences.
